intro: Sphalmium, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking, spiky flower heads and silver-gray foliage. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and saline soils, showing a high tolerance for salt and wind. Sphalmium species often have a compact growth habit and are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal. They play an important ecological role in stabilizing dunes and supporting coastal biodiversity.
